page.title: 07VILLAGE LIFE, BENINGTON (2)
page.content: There is a Meals on Wheels service and an Over 60 Club held fortnightly. There are no Old People's Homes, elderly folk needing care usually going to Steven- age. There is not a great deal for the youth of the village. There is a Youth Club on Fridays and a Sports Club. There is no Doctor or Dentist. Parents take their children to a Health Clinic in Walkern. Surprisingly there are more modern than older houses in Benington.The new hous- ing tends to be up-market. All housing is relatively expensive. A Herts C.C. Library Van calls weekly. There are no Banking facilities. There are several active clubs: British Legion, Brownies, Scouts, Cubs, Guides, Cricket, Soccer & Badminton. There are inter-village competitions. Benington has its own policeman, living in a police house in the village.
